intro: Hieraciodes alpina, commonly known as alpine everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant is known for its delicate, fluffy white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Hieraciodes alpina thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows at high altitudes. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
